plants.name: Camellia japonica
plants.description: An evergreen shrub known for its glossy dark green leaves and large, showy flowers which bloom in mid-winter to early spring. The flowers can be single or double and range from white to deep pink or red.
plants.location: Temperate regions of East Asia, widely cultivated in temperate gardens worldwide
plants.funFact: Camellia japonica was a highly prized flower in Victorian England and is the symbol of perfection and excellence in some cultures.

plants.name: Erica carnea
plants.description: A low-growing evergreen shrub with bell-shaped flowers, often found blooming in late winter and early spring. It thrives in colder climates and rocky soils.
plants.location: Alps and other mountainous regions of Europe
plants.funFact: Winter Heath is one of the earliest flowering plants in Europe and is often used in rock gardens and winter flower beds.

plants.name: Mahonia aquifolium
plants.description: An evergreen shrub with holly-like leaves and bright yellow flower clusters that bloom in late winter. Its berries resemble grapes and turn blue-purple when ripe.
plants.funFact: The flowers of Oregon Grape are an important early nectar source for bees emerging in late winter.

plants.name: Helleborus niger
plants.description: A perennial herbaceous plant with large white flowers that often bloom in late winter, sometimes around Christmas and extending into January. It prefers shaded areas.
plants.location: Mountainous regions of Europe, cultivated in gardens worldwide
plants.funFact: Despite its name, the Christmas Rose is not a true rose and its flowers are toxic if ingested.
